v.v: Woe to you, destroyer who has not been destroyed!
Yahweh, be gracious to us; we wait for you;
At the loud noise the peoples flee; when you arise, the nations are scattered.
Your spoil is gathered as the locusts gather; as locusts leap, men leap on it.
Yahweh is exalted. He lives in a high place. He will fill Zion with justice and righteousness.
He will be the stability in your times,

v: Woe to the betrayer whom they have not betrayed!
When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed.
When you stop betraying, they will betray you.
be our arm every morning, our salvation in the time of trouble.
abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge; the fear of Yahweh is his treasure.

v.v: Look, their envoys cry in the streets; the diplomats hoping for peace weep bitterly.
The highways are deserted; there are no more travelers.
The land mourns and withers away; Lebanon is ashamed and withers away;
“Now will I arise,” says Yahweh; “now I will be lifted up; now I will be elevated.
You conceive chaff, and you give birth to stubble; your breath is a fire that will consume you.
The peoples will be burned to lime, as thornbushes are cut down and are burned.
You who are far away, hear what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my might.”
The sinners in Zion are afraid; trembling has seized the godless ones.
He who walks righteously and speaks honestly;
this is the man who will dwell on the heights,
Your eyes will see the king in his beauty; they will see a land off in the distance.
Your heart will recall the terror; where is the scribe, where is he who weighed the money? Where is he who counted the towers?
You will no longer see the defiant people, a people of a strange language that you do not understand.
Look at Zion, the city of our feasts;
Instead, Yahweh in majesty will be with us, in a place of broad rivers and streams.
For Yahweh is our judge, Yahweh is our lawgiver, Yahweh is our king; he will save us.
Your riggings are slack; they cannot hold the mast in place; they cannot spread the sail;
The inhabitants will not say, “I am sick;” the people who live there will be forgiven for their iniquity.

v: Covenants are broken, witnesses are despised, and mankind is not respected.
Sharon is like a desert plain; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their leaves.
Who among us can sojourn with a raging fire? Who among us can sojourn with everlasting burnings?
who despises the gain of oppression,
who shakes his hand so that it will not accept a bribe,
who stops his ears from hearing about bloodshed,
and who shuts his eyes from looking on evil—
his place of defense will be the fortress among the cliffs,
his food will be given, and his water will be in steady supply.
your eyes will see Jerusalem as a quiet habitation, a tent that will not be removed,
whose stakes will never be pulled up nor will any of its cords be broken.
No warship with oars will travel it, and no large ships will sail by.
when the great spoil is divided, even the lame will drag off the spoil.
